Message:
This village, called
the Village of Musicians,
took pride in its beautiful lake,

where musicians would always
gather to play their songs.

I was also invited
to play with them,
but lacking the courage to
perform in front of others,
I let fear overtake me
and ran away...

How could I not?
I mean, what if I were
to make a mistake...?

But, when I played my harp
off by myself, I could hear
music in the distance.
It was as though it were
in step with my own playing.

“There’s no rush.
Come join us when
you feel up to it.”

I felt as if that was what
the music was saying.
So, I played a melody in turn.

“Thank you.
Once I muster the courage,
I shall join you...”

Our separated chords echoed
as though in conversation.
